about.description:
opyplus is a python package is a package that can be used to work with EnergyPlus in Python.
More specifically, it allows to::
     Parse, query and modify idf files efficiently, with a number of checks ensuring that your idf file remains correct throughout your work
     Parse and create epw files
     Launch simulations on EnergyPlus
     Parse EnergyPlus output files
about.summary: A package to work with EnergyPlus in python

name: opyplus

new_version_errors.9.0.1:
The recipe did not change in the version migration, a URL did not hash, or there is jinja2 syntax the bot cannot handle!

Please check the URLs in your recipe with version '9.0.1' to make sure they exist!

We also found the following errors:

 - could not hash URL template 'https://github.com/openergy/opyplus/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz'

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "opyplus" %}
{% set version = "1.0.3" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/openergy/opyplus/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: fb4b4e60198a6ad2984a17f4f8c16a3b1e126fa344584525dafbb9f922ea47f2

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - python >=3.6
    - pip
  run:
    - python >=3.6
    - pandas >=0.20.0,<2.0
    - unidecode >=1.0.22,<2.0
    - python-slugify >=3.0.2,<4.0
    - cchardet >=2.1.4,<3.0

test:
  imports:
    - opyplus

about:
  home: https://github.com/openergy/opyplus
  license: MPL-2.0
  license_family: MOZILLA
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: A package to work with EnergyPlus in python
  description: |
    opyplus is a python package is a package that can be used to work with EnergyPlus in Python. 
    More specifically, it allows to::
         Parse, query and modify idf files efficiently, with a number of checks ensuring that your idf file remains correct throughout your work
         Parse and create epw files
         Launch simulations on EnergyPlus
         Parse EnergyPlus output files
  doc_url: https://opyplus.readthedocs.io/
  dev_url: https://github.com/openergy/opyplus

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - zach-b
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.6.16
